channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Man City close to agreeing terms with Semenyo
item.description: Manchester City are close to agreeing terms with Bournemouth to sign Antoine Semenyo for £65m.

item.title: Johnson to decide future after Palace deal agreed
item.description: Brennan Johnson is set to decide whether he wants to join Crystal Palace after the south London club agreed a £35m deal to sign the Tottenham attacker.

item.title: 'Absolutely pivotal' - Championship transfer window preview
item.description: With the winter window opening on 1 January, BBC Sport correspondents assess the transfer needs of the 24 Championship clubs.

item.title: Hamilton players threaten no-show after pay delay
item.description: Hamilton Academical players are considering refusing to play Saturday's Scottish League 1 match against East Fife if they are not paid on time.

item.title: 'Alarm bells should be ringing' over England tickets
item.description: A fan group says "alarm bells should be ringing at Fifa" at England fans not taking up their full allocation for the World Cup final and semi-final.

item.title: Forest ask for VAR audio after Man City defeat
item.description: Nottingham Forest have asked to hear the VAR audio as they consider making an official complaint following the Premier League defeat by Manchester City.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Sunderland fan Tom A Smith
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter and Sunderland fan Tom A Smith - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Matlock rehire boss Clayton 48 hours after he left
item.description: Adam Clayton becomes his own managerial replacement after being appointed Matlock Town boss two days after he was released by mutual consent.

item.title: Every Semenyo Premier League goal this season
item.description: Watch all nine goals of Antoine Semenyo's goals for Bournemouth this season, as the forward inches towards a move to Manchester City.

item.title: 'Proud of the journey I've been on' - Greenwood on MBE honour
item.description: England and Manchester City defender Alex Greenwood tells BBC Radio 5 Live she is "proud of the journey" she has been on as she is appointed an MBE in the 2025 New Year Honours.

item.title: Title talk in December 'doesn't make sense' - Emery
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says it "does not make sense" to speak about the title race in December, after rising to third place in the Premier League.

item.title: Formation change not because of pressure - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says he has not changed their formation because of "pressure from the media or fans".

item.title: How Raya was able to execute 'absolutely brilliant' save against Brighton
item.description: Match of the day Pundit Joe Hart breaks down how David Raya was able to execute an 'absolutely brilliant' save for Arsenal in their 2-1 victory over Brighton.

item.title: Wiegman gets honorary damehood in New Year Honours
item.description: Ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean become a dame and knight in the New Year Honours list, while England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is made an honorary dame.

item.title: 'Let's make history' - Miura, 58, joins new club
item.description: Kazuyoshi Miura, who turns 59 in February and is the world's oldest professional footballer, has signed a loan deal until June with Fukushima United.

item.title: Honours for football executives who helped save Celtic and Hearts
item.description: Former Celtic chief executive Fergus McCann and ex-Hearts chair Ann Budge have been recognised in the New Year Honours.

item.title: Liverpool set-piece coach Briggs leaves club
item.description: Liverpool set-piece coach Aaron Briggs leaves the club amid the problems in dead-ball situations this season.

item.title: Tottenham sign Sweden defender Wijk
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur confirm the signing of BK Hacken defender Hannah Wijk on a long-term contract, subject to international clearance and work permit.

item.title: 'It's a mystery' - why Premier League teams haven't played every club yet
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League teams have not played every opponent yet despite being at the midway point in the season.

item.title: Gray heads Spurs to victory at Crystal Palace
item.description: Nineteen-year-old Archie Gray scores his first senior goal for Tottenham Hotspur to beat Crystal Palace 1-0.

item.title: Calvert-Lewin earns draw for Leeds at Sunderland
item.description: Dominic Calvert-Lewin scores his seventh goal in six games for Leeds United to draw 1-1 with Sunderland.

item.title: Watkins double fires Aston Villa to stunning win at Chelsea
item.description: Substitute Ollie Watkins fires a second-half double as Aston Villa fight back from a goal down to beat Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Arsenal return to top of table with win over Brighton
item.description: Arsenal return to the top of the table with Martin Odegaard scoring his first Premier League goal of the season to beat Brighton 2-1.

item.title: Cherki stars in late Manchester City win against Nottingham Forest
item.description: Rayan Cherki assists in the first half and scores late in the second for Manchester City to beat Nottingham Forest 2-1 and get their sixth Premier League win in a row.

item.title: Wirtz scores first Liverpool goal in victory against Wolves
item.description: Liverpool score twice within a minute as Florian Wirtz scores his first goal for his side to beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-1.

item.title: Schade fires hat-trick as Brentford thrash Bournemouth
item.description: Kevin Schade scores a hat-trick as Brentford beat Bournemouth 4-1.

item.title: Kavanagh promoted to Uefa elite list of referees
item.description: Chris Kavanagh has been promoted to the elite list of Uefa referees alongside Michael Oliver and Anthony Taylor.

item.title: New right-back Altena 'can thrive' at Hearts
item.description: RKC Waalwijk right-back Jordi Altena will join Hearts on 1 January, having agreed a deal until the summer of 2029.

item.title: Wilkinson hoping Fishlock will join Wales staff
item.description: Rhian Wilkinson hopes Jess Fishlock will join Wales' staff for the start of World Cup qualifying in March.

item.title: Bournemouth eye Johnson - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Bournemouth identify Brennan Johnson and Abdul Fatawu as potential replacements for Antoine Semenyo, Liverpool want to wait until the summer to sign Marc Guehi, and Everton are interested in Manchester United duo Kobbie Mainoo and Joshua Zirkzee, plus more.

item.title: Quartet of World Cup berths up for grabs in 2026
item.description: Three words will dominate the talk around international football across the island of Ireland in 2026 - the World Cup.

item.title: Time is right to change Man Utd formation - Amorim
item.description: Head coach Ruben Amorim says if he had changed Manchester United's formation because of media pressure it would have been "the end" for him.

item.title: Arsenal 'actively looking' at January signings
item.description: Arsenal will be "actively looking" at potential signings during the January transfer window, says manager Mikel Arteta.

item.title: Motherwell seek answer from SFA after no Ibrox penalty
item.description: Motherwell are seeking an explanation for a rejected penalty claim at Ibrox, although manager Jens Berthel Askou is keen to move on from the incident.

item.title: West Ham to back Nuno in January window
item.description: Relegation-threatened West Ham are committed to backing manager Nuno Espirito Santo in the transfer market next month.

item.title: Man Utd sign Germany forward with 'phenomenal' goals record
item.description: Manchester United have signed Germany international Lea Schuller from Bayern Munich until June 2029.

item.title: I thought I was going to die after collapse - Rush
item.description: Liverpool legend Ian Rush says he thought he was close to dying after contracting superflu earlier in December and spending five days in hospital.

item.title: Leeds 'brimming with confidence' in full-team goal - Hart
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Joe Hart and Danny Murphy praise Leeds United's build-up play, which resulted in Dominic Calvert-Lewin's equaliser against Sunderland.

item.title: Richarlison excels in otherwise 'not great' game for Spurs - Hart
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Joe Hart says Richarlison stood out for Tottenham Hotspur in a match where they were 'absolutely battered' by Crystal Palace despite winning 1-0.

item.title: Wirtz showing glimpses of a top, top player - Rooney
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Wayne Rooney praises the performance and development of Florian Wirtz after he scored his first Premier League goal for Liverpool in their 2-1 win over Wolves.

item.title: Spurs showed resilience - Frank
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Thomas Frank says he is proud of his side's discipline and resilience in their 1-0 win against Crystal Palace.

item.title: Emery's triple change fires Villa to victory at Chelsea
item.description: Match of the Day's Wayne Rooney analyses why Unai Emery's second-half substitutions were so impactful as Aston Villa came from a goal down to beat Chelsea 2-1 at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Ronaldo will not retire until he scores 1,000 goals
item.description: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo says he will not end his playing career until he scores his 1,000th career goal.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Villa will not speak about league target until game 34 - Emery
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery insists it is still too early to say whether his side is in contention for the Premier League title despite being third in the table after their 2-1 victory against Chelsea.

item.title: How releasing Reijnders gave Man City win at Forest
item.description: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer analyses the half-time tactical tweak from Manchester City which released Tijani Reijnders into attacking areas and gave City a vital 2-1 win at Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Equaliser changed dynamic of game - Maresca
item.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says that his side dominated the game in the first hour but were unable to respond to the shift in dynamics after they conceded the first goal to Aston Villa.

item.title: Arsenal should have won by more - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta say his team's next step is to capitalise on their chances more and create bigger scorelines after a 2-1 win against Brighton.

item.title: Liverpool should be winning more comfortably - Slot
item.description: Arne Slot says Liverpool are doing enough things right to be winning their matches more comfortably following a nervy 2-1 victory against Premier League bottom club Wolves.

item.title: Infantino defends World Cup ticket prices
item.description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino defends the cost of World Cup tickets following "absolutely crazy" demand from the public.

item.title: Are Chelsea subs good enough – or should Maresca be blamed?
item.description: Chelsea dropping more points from winning positions than any other Premier League team is "not random" says manager Enzo Maresca as he tries "to understand why".

item.title: Lazio's ex-Chelsea boss Sarri has heart surgery
item.description: Lazio manager Maurizio Sarri, 66, undergoes a minor heart operation.

item.title: Managers are not magicians - Guardiola on Man City revival
item.description: Boss Pep Guardiola believes the "fog" has lifted as Manchester City extend run to eight victories in a row.

item.title: 'I cannot forget this until I die' - Sudan's players on horrors of civil war
item.description: Forward John Mano, who lost his best friend to the civil war in Sudan, says the squad will "fight" for their country on the pitch at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Man City found right mentality to beat Nottingham Forest - Guardiola
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says that his side had the necessary mentality to come back after Christmas and beat Nottingham Forest 2-1.

item.title: Match officials had 'bad day at office' - Dyche
item.description: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche says he cannot understand the match officials' calls against his side in their 2-1 defeat by Manchester City.

item.title: 'Everything bad happens to us' - Nuno on West Ham defeat by Fulham
item.description: West Ham United boss Nuno Santo says that his side were punished for a mistake during a 1-0 defeat by Fulham.

item.title: Stunning Dorgu volley gives Man Utd win over Newcastle
item.description: Manchester United hold on to take all three points in a hard-fought 1-0 win against Newcastle, with Ruben Amorim's side moving into the top five.

item.title: Semenyo? Guehi? Who will move in January?
item.description: BBC senior football correspondent Sami Mokbel gives Football Focus the lowdown on whether Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo and Crystal Palace's Marc Guehi will move clubs in January.

item.title: 'More exciting than Yamal'. Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
item.description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

item.title: EFL Quiz of the Year: Who has been breaking records in 2025?
item.description: From record-breakers to dire financial situations, there's been much to talk about in the English Football League in 2025 - but do you remember the finer details?

item.title: Tomori on Tuchel, living in Italy and why this is the best he has felt
item.description: Fikayo Tomori says his success at AC Milan shows English players "can go abroad and adapt to a different way of living".

item.title: 'Just reach out' - Man Utd's Bennett on his father's suicide
item.description: Manchester United defender Rhys Bennett discusses his father's death in October to help raise awareness of mental health issues.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: Who's leading the race for the Golden Shoe?
item.description: As the halfway mark of the 2025-26 campaign approaches, BBC Sport takes a look at the frontrunners for this season's European Golden Shoe award.

item.title: Spain to face Argentina in Finalissima - but what is it?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when and where the 2026 Finalissima is.

item.title: Why is there only one Premier League game on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why there is just one Premier League match on Sunday this weekend

item.title: Unlucky to miss out? Who makes the alternative World XI?
item.description: The Fifa Best Men's XI was announced on Tuesday in Qatar, but who was unfortunate to miss out? BBC Sport takes a look at an alternative World XI.

item.title: Why have footballers started their own YouTube channels?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why football players have started their own YouTube channels.

item.title: Why are the queues to enter Anfield growing?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why Liverpool fans have been asked to arrive at Anfield 10 minutes earlier than usual.

item.title: El Passico at Fir Park, Gassama & Martindale in focus
item.description: Here is what to look out for on the final round of Scottish Premiership fixtures for 2025, including Motherwell v Celtic, Djeidi Gassama's form and the pressure on David Martindale.

item.title: Kettlewell returns to County tasked with avoiding drop
item.description: Stuart Kettlewell returns to Ross County as manager - but only on a short-term contract tasked with steering the Dingwall side clear of second successive relegation.

item.title: Defender Araujo linked with Celtic - gossip
item.description: Celtic's January transfer window plans take shape as former Rangers manager is linked with Columbus Crew.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Maccabi Tel Aviv given suspended one-match away fan ban
item.description: Maccabi Tel Aviv receive a suspended one-match away fan ban by Uefa after racist chanting during their Europa League game against Stuttgart.

item.title: Dembele wins Fifa Best men's player of the year
item.description: Paris St-Germain and France forward Ousmane Dembele is named the men's player of the year at the Fifa Best awards.

item.title: Passmoor wants to stabilise Leicester as legacy
item.description: Leicester City manager Rick Passmoor says his aim was to "stabilise" the club in his first few months in charge and hopes to leave a legacy for others to follow.

item.title: Miyazawa signs long-term deal with Man Utd
item.description: Hinata Miyazawa signs new deal with Manchester United after her previous contract was due to expire in June.

item.title: Sweden defender Lundkvist agrees Man Utd deal
item.description: Manchester United agree a deal to sign Sweden international Hanna Lundkvist.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
